intro: Kohleria guazumifolia, commonly known as the Guazumifolia kohleria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features fleshy, glossy leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Kohleria guazumifolia is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
